topic.title: Best way to help ZeroNet with spare network resources?
topic.body:
I run a small privacy focused business offering a "BS" blocking VPN service as well as webhosting/servers. We do a lot of I2P stuff, some Tor stuff and even a little Yggdrasil stuff but don't really donate any spare resources to Zeronet and I'd like to change that.

What does Zeronet need the most right now to help the network? Does location diversity matter much with ZeroNet? (Ex: Needing trackers or peers in under represented locations?)

1626704177_1JMn7zrA5b35HR8wTSeyQrbCSxj2L.body:
> [styromaniac](#comment_3156_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): More zero:// trackers would be nice.

Any particular guides on setting one up? I could host one in Finland and another in Luxembourg or Netherlands or something.

> [kapec](#comment_112_1CQ14MAUEp55ijU6rQLQ9vZdzxCQe9s1SF): Could you run zeronet node in yggdrassil network? 

Possibly, like a Yggdrasil to ZeroNet bridge? I know there exists a I2P to ZeroNet bridge. Yggdrasil just pushed a big update and I need to reconfigure my existing things to be compatible. But a Yggdrasil ZeroNet instance shouldn't be difficult and could be useful!
